title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: 'Raising questions' isn't enough. The best films of the year took a stance
items.description: Now is not the time for subtlety, nostalgia or neutrality on screen.

items.title: From chess to a medical mystery: Great global reads from 2025 you may have missed

items.title: Ukraine denies drone attack on Putin's residence
items.description: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting a presidential residence, which President Zelensky called "typical Russian lies".

items.title: The U.S. offers Ukraine a 15-year security guarantee for now, Zelenskyy says
items.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace pl...

items.title: Nepal to scrap 'failed' Mount Everest waste deposit scheme
items.description: Under the scheme, climbers paid a $4,000 deposit that was returned if they brought 8kg of waste down the mountain.

items.title: FIFA president defends World Cup ticket prices, saying demand is hitting records

items.title: Trump says Ukraine peace is closer. And, how funding cuts affect anti-poverty groups

items.title: Trump meets Netanyahu in Florida as focus turns to Middle East issues
items.description: They are set to discuss Iran, Lebanon, Syria and Gaza, where the Trump administration wants to see the ceasefire enter its second stage in January.

items.title: Egyptian dissident sorry for tweets after calls for deportation from UK
items.description: Shabana Mahmood is facing growing calls to revoke the citizenship of Alaa Abdel Fattah after the emergence of social media posts.

items.title: US pledges $2bn for humanitarian aid, but tells UN 'adapt or die'
items.description: The pledge was welcomed by the UN, but comes after previous major cuts to US funding for humanitarian operations.
